p:
Estimates of the probability of HIV transmission per exposure through receptive syringe sharing range from 0.0051 to 0.0189, depending on the genetic subtype (B vs. E) [ 24â€“ 26]. We thus use a reference value P
ref of 0.008, which is similar to the ones in Patel et al. [ 27] and Bobashev and Zule [ 23]. Because most of the estimates of the HIV risk were obtained from studies in Thailand, we assume that PWID injected PH and used HDS syringes [ 20]. We assume that most sharing occurred during the latent phase of HIV when the viral burden was around 10,000 copies per milliliter.
